message_1: A factory produces 500 units of product A per day. When the temperature drops by 10 degrees Celsius, the production of product A drops by 50 units per day. What will be the daily production of product A if the temperature drops by 20 degrees Celsius?
message_2:
If the production of product A drops by 50 units per day when the temperature drops by 10 degrees Celsius, then when the temperature drops by 20 degrees Celsius, the production will drop by 50 units * 2 = 100 units per day.

The factory initially produces 500 units of product A per day. So, when the temperature drops by 20 degrees Celsius, the daily production will be 500 units - 100 units = 400 units of product A.
